definitions.definition: To belabour , to emphasise or expand upon (a point in a debate, etc).
examples: I think we've all got the idea. There's no need to labour the point.

definitions.definition: To be oppressed with difficulties or disease; to do one's work under conditions which make it especially hard or wearisome; to move slowly, as against opposition, or under a burden.
To suffer the pangs of childbirth .
To pitch or roll heavily, as a ship in a turbulent sea.

secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To belabour , to emphasise or expand upon (a point in a debate, etc).
To be oppressed with difficulties or disease; to do one's work under conditions which make it especially hard or wearisome; to move slowly, as against opposition, or under a burden.
To suffer the pangs of childbirth .
( nautical ) To pitch or roll heavily, as a ship in a turbulent sea.
